column4: is there any way for me to access my samba shares mounted via nautilus in a Qt application?
you should be able to with the gnome-vfs libs
but that is going to be some annoying dependency for users
well i know that but im trying to access my Qt4 project files from QDevelop which doesnt support gnome-vfs as of yet
since it's smb why not just use mount?
because for whatever reason, i dont have write permissions when i use mount
even if i pass the rw flag and of course my credentials, i get permission denied when i try to do anything besides read/trove directories
who is the owner of the files when you do an ls?
and are you supplying a uid/gid when mounting?
no i didnt know fileshares had a uid :/
well your credientials are for the remote side, but you can specify who owns them on the local side
okay, u know which mount flag i can use to do that
same way you are specifying the rw -o rw,uid=...,gid=...
you can use 'id maddog39' to find your uid/gid in case you don't know what they are :)
okay thanks, i think i got it lol, i never actually knew what uid/gid on a drive meant, thought it was something else
hey thanks, its all working now
